meanings.definition: Used to express obviousness or stupidity.
meanings.sent1: Duh! Of course the sun rises in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She rolled her eyes and said, 'Duh, everyone knows that.'
meanings.sent3: When the cat tried to chase its own tail, it looked like it was saying 'duh' to itself.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was so simple, it made me feel like I was hearing 'duh' in every sentence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's facepalm clearly communicated a big 'duh' moment.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate that something is self-evident.
meanings.sent1: She walked into the room and saw the mess, then said 'duh' before turning around.
meanings.sent2: The answer was right in front of him, so he thought, 'duh, why didn't I see that?'
meanings.sent3: The sign saying 'push' on the door made him feel like saying 'duh' out loud.
meanings.sent4: The solution to the puzzle was so clear, it practically shouted 'duh' at him.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the task made him feel like he was living in a world of 'duh'.

meanings.definition: Used to show disbelief or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Duh! I can't believe you forgot your keys again.
meanings.sent2: When she heard the excuse, she just said 'duh' and walked away.
meanings.sent3: His reaction to the news was a loud 'duh' followed by a deep sigh.
meanings.sent4: The repeated mistakes made him want to scream 'duh' at the top of his lungs.
meanings.sent5: The constant interruptions were like a chorus of 'duh' in his ears.
